import json
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Dict, List

class NISTCSFAssessor:
    """NIST Cybersecurity Framework Assessor - COMPLETELY FREE!"""
    
    def __init__(self):
        # CSF 2.0 Core Functions
        self.core_functions = {
            'GOVERN': {
                'name': 'Govern',
                'description': 'Establish and monitor cybersecurity risk management strategy',
                'categories': [
                    'GV.OC: Organizational Context',
                    'GV.RM: Risk Management Strategy',
                    'GV.SC: Supply Chain Risk Management',
                    'GV.PO: Policies and Procedures',
                    'GV.OV: Oversight'
                ]
            },
            'IDENTIFY': {
                'name': 'Identify',
                'description': 'Develop understanding to manage cybersecurity risk',
                'categories': [
                    'ID.AM: Asset Management',
                    'ID.BE: Business Environment',
                    'ID.RA: Risk Assessment',
                    'ID.RM: Risk Management Strategy',
                    'ID.SC: Supply Chain Risk Management'
                ]
            },
            'PROTECT': {
                'name': 'Protect',
                'description': 'Develop and implement safeguards',
                'categories': [
                    'PR.AC: Identity Management and Access Control',
                    'PR.AT: Awareness and Training',
                    'PR.DS: Data Security',
                    'PR.IP: Information Protection Processes',
                    'PR.MA: Maintenance',
                    'PR.PT: Protective Technology'
                ]
            },
            'DETECT': {
                'name': 'Detect',
                'description': 'Develop and implement activities to identify cybersecurity events',
                'categories': [
                    'DE.AE: Anomalies and Events',
                    'DE.CM: Security Continuous Monitoring',
                    'DE.DP: Detection Processes'
                ]
            },
            'RESPOND': {
                'name': 'Respond',
                'description': 'Develop and implement activities for detected events',
                'categories': [
                    'RS.RP: Response Planning',
                    'RS.CO: Communications',
                    'RS.AN: Analysis',
                    'RS.MI: Mitigation',
                    'RS.IM: Improvements'
                ]
            },
            'RECOVER': {
                'name': 'Recover',
                'description': 'Develop and implement activities for resilience',
                'categories': [
                    'RC.RP: Recovery Planning',
                    'RC.IM: Improvements',
                    'RC.CO: Communications'
                ]
            }
        }
        
        # Implementation Tiers
        self.implementation_tiers = {
            1: 'Partial - Ad hoc and reactive',
            2: 'Risk Informed - Risk-aware but not organization-wide',
            3: 'Repeatable - Formal policy exists',
            4: 'Adaptive - Continuous improvement'
        }
    
    def display_framework_overview(self):
        """Display NIST CSF overview (FREE!)"""
        print("🛡️ NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0 (FREE!)\n")
        
        print("📊 Core Functions:\n")
        for func_id, func_data in self.core_functions.items():
            print(f"   {func_id}: {func_data['name']}")
            print(f"      {func_data['description']}")
            print(f"      Categories: {len(func_data['categories'])}")
            print()
        
        print("📈 Implementation Tiers:\n")
        for tier, description in self.implementation_tiers.items():
            print(f"   Tier {tier}: {description}")
        
        return self.core_functions
    
    def assess_maturity(self, assessments: Dict[str, int]):
        """Assess cybersecurity maturity (FREE!)"""
        print("📋 Cybersecurity Maturity Assessment (FREE!)\n")
        
        total_score = 0
        function_scores = {}
        
        for function, score in assessments.items():
            if function in self.core_functions:
                function_scores[function] = score
                total_score += score
                
                print(f"   {function}: {self.core_functions[function]['name']}")
                print(f"      Current Tier: {score}")
                print(f"      Status: {self.implementation_tiers.get(score, 'Unknown')}")
                print()
        
        avg_score = total_score / len(function_scores) if function_scores else 0
        
        print(f"\n📊 Overall Maturity: {avg_score:.1f}")
        
        if avg_score < 2:
            print("   ⚠️ Status: Needs Immediate Attention")
            print("   Recommendation: Develop formal risk management processes")
        elif avg_score < 3:
            print("   🟡 Status: Progressing")
            print("   Recommendation: Standardize practices organization-wide")
        elif avg_score < 4:
            print("   🟢 Status: Mature")
            print("   Recommendation: Focus on continuous improvement")
        else:
            print("   ✅ Status: Optimized")
            print("   Recommendation: Maintain and share best practices")
        
        return function_scores
    
    def generate_implementation_plan(self, target_tier=3):
        """Generate implementation plan (FREE!)"""
        print(f"📝 NIST CSF Implementation Plan (Target Tier: {target_tier})\n")
        
        phases = [
            {
                'phase': 'Phase 1: Establish Governance (0-3 months)',
                'activities': [
                    'Form cybersecurity team',
                    'Define roles and responsibilities',
                    'Establish risk management strategy',
                    'Create cybersecurity policy',
                    'Identify critical assets'
                ]
            },
            {
                'phase': 'Phase 2: Implement Core Controls (3-6 months)',
                'activities': [
                    'Deploy identity and access management',
                    'Implement data protection controls',
                    'Establish security monitoring',
                    'Create incident response procedures',
                    'Develop recovery plans'
                ]
            },
            {
                'phase': 'Phase 3: Enhance Detection (6-9 months)',
                'activities': [
                    'Deploy continuous monitoring',
                    'Implement anomaly detection',
                    'Establish threat intelligence',
                    'Create detection processes',
                    'Implement security analytics'
                ]
            },
            {
                'phase': 'Phase 4: Mature Response (9-12 months)',
                'activities': [
                    'Enhance incident response',
                    'Establish communications protocols',
                    'Implement forensics capabilities',
                    'Create improvement processes',
                    'Conduct regular exercises'
                ]
            }
        ]
        
        for phase_data in phases:
            print(f"📅 {phase_data['phase']}")
            for activity in phase_data['activities']:
                print(f"   □ {activity}")
            print()
        
        return phases
    
    def map_to_standards(self):
        """Map CSF to other standards (FREE!)"""
        print("🔗 NIST CSF Mapping to Standards (FREE!)\n")
        
        mappings = {
            'ISO 27001/27002': [
                'Comprehensive mapping available',
                'Covers all CSF categories',
                'Helps with dual compliance'
            ],
            'CIS Controls': [
                'Direct mapping to CIS Controls v8',
                'Prioritized implementation guidance',
                'Technical control alignment'
            ],
            'COBIT': [
                'Governance framework alignment',
                'Process maturity mapping',
                'IT management integration'
            ],
            'NIST 800-53': [
                'Detailed control mapping',
                'Federal compliance support',
                'Security control catalog'
            ],
            'PCI DSS': [
                'Payment card security alignment',
                'Compliance requirement mapping',
                'Gap analysis support'
            ]
        }
        
        for standard, benefits in mappings.items():
            print(f"📚 {standard}:")
            for benefit in benefits:
                print(f"   • {benefit}")
            print()
        
        return mappings
    
    def get_resources(self):
        """Get free NIST resources (FREE!)"""
        print("📚 Free NIST CSF Resources (ALL FREE!)\n")
        
        resources = {
            'Core Documents': [
                ('Framework Core', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/framework'),
                ('CSF 2.0 PDF', 'https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/CSWP/NIST.CSWP.29.pdf'),
                ('Quick Start Guide', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/getting-started'),
                ('Reference Tool', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/csf-reference-tool')
            ],
            'Implementation': [
                ('Small Business Guide', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/small-business'),
                ('Success Stories', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/success-stories'),
                ('Industry Resources', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/industry-resources'),
                ('International Resources', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/international-resources')
            ],
            'Assessment Tools': [
                ('Self-Assessment', 'Available from NIST'),
                ('Maturity Models', 'Multiple free options'),
                ('Gap Analysis Templates', 'Downloadable'),
                ('Crosswalk Tools', 'Standards mapping')
            ],
            'Training': [
                ('NIST Training', 'https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/training'),
                ('Online Learning', 'Free courses available'),
                ('Webinars', 'Regular free sessions'),
                ('Workshops', 'Regional events')
            ]
        }
        
        for category, items in resources.items():
            print(f"📂 {category}:")
            for name, description in items:
                print(f"   • {name}: {description}")
            print()
        
        return resources

# Usage
assessor = NISTCSFAssessor()
assessor.display_framework_overview()
# Example assessment
assessments = {
    'GOVERN': 2,
    'IDENTIFY': 3,
    'PROTECT': 2,
    'DETECT': 2,
    'RESPOND': 3,
    'RECOVER': 2
}
assessor.assess_maturity(assessments)
assessor.generate_implementation_plan()
